verses.verse: And Jehovah<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>,

Speak <WH1696> unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, that they turn<WH7725> back and encamp<WH2583> before<WH6440> Pi-hahiroth<WH6367>, between Migdol<WH4024> and the sea<WH3220>, before<WH5226> Baal-zephon<WH1189>: over against<WH6440> it shall ye encamp<WH2583> by the sea<WH3220>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> will say<WH559> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, They are entangled<WH943> in the land<WH776>, the wilderness<WH4057> hath shut them in<WH5462>.

And I will harden<WH2388> Pharaoh<WH6547>'s heart<WH3820>, and he shall follow<WH7291> after<WH310> them<WH3513>; and I will get me honor upon Pharaoh<WH6547>, and upon all his host<WH2428>; and the Egyptians<WH4714> shall know<WH3045> that I am Jehovah<WH3068>. And they did so<WH6213>.

And it was told<WH5046> the king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> that the people<WH5971> were fled<WH1272>: and the heart<WH3824> of Pharaoh<WH6547> and of his servants<WH5650> was changed<WH2015> towards the people<WH5971>, and they said<WH559>, What is this we have done<WH6213>, that we have let Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971> from serving us<WH5647>?
And he made ready<WH631> his chariot<WH7393>, and took<WH3947> his people with him<WH5971>:
and he took<WH3947> six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> chosen<WH977> chariots<WH7393>, and all the chariots<WH7393> of Egypt<WH4714>, and captains over all of them<WH7991>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> the heart<WH3820> of Pharaoh<WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714>, and he pursued<WH7291> after<WH310> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>: for the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went out<WH3318> with a high<WH7311> hand<WH3027>.

And the Egyptians<WH4714> pursued<WH7291> after<WH310> them<WH5483>, all the horses and chariots<WH7393> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, and his horsemen<WH6571>, and his army<WH2428>, and overtook<WH5381> them encamping<WH2583> by the sea<WH3220>, beside Pi-hahiroth<WH6367>, before<WH6440> Baal-zephon<WH1189>.

And when Pharaoh<WH6547> drew nigh<WH7126>, the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> lifted up<WH5375> their eyes<WH5869>, and<WH4714>, behold, the Egyptians were marching<WH5265> after<WH310> them<WH3966>; and they were sore afraid<WH3372>: and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried out<WH6817> unto Jehovah<WH3068>.

And they said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Because there were no graves<WH6913> in Egypt<WH4714>, hast thou taken us away<WH3947> to die<WH4191> in the wilderness<WH4057>? wherefore<WH2063> hast thou dealt<WH6213> thus with us<WH3318>, to bring us forth out of Egypt<WH4714>?

Is not this the word<WH1697> that we spake<WH1696> unto thee in Egypt<WH4714>, saying<WH559>, Let us alone<WH2308>, that we may serve<WH5647> the Egyptians<WH4714>? For it were better<WH2896> for us to serve<WH5647> the Egyptians<WH4714>, than that we should die<WH4191> in the wilderness<WH4057>.

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto the people<WH5971>, Fear<WH3372> ye not<WH3320>, stand still, and see<WH7200> the salvation<WH3444> of Jehovah<WH3068>, which he will work<WH6213> for you to-day<WH3117>: for the Egyptians<WH4714> whom ye have seen<WH7200> to-day<WH3117>, ye shall see<WH7200> them again<WH3254> no more for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.
Jehovah <WH3068> will fight<WH3898> for you<WH2790>, and ye shall hold your peace.
And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Wherefore criest<WH6817> thou unto me<WH1696>? speak unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, that they go forward<WH5265>.

And lift thou up<WH7311> thy rod<WH4294>, and stretch out<WH5186> thy hand<WH3027> over the sea<WH3220>, and divide<WH1234> it<WH1121>: and the children of Israel<WH3478> shall go<WH935> into the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220> on dry ground<WH3004>.

And I<WH2388>, behold, I will harden the hearts<WH3820> of the Egyptians<WH4714>, and they shall go in after<WH935> them<WH310>: and I will get me honor<WH3513> upon Pharaoh<WH6547>, and upon all his host<WH2428>, upon his chariots<WH7393>, and upon his horsemen<WH6571>.
And the Egyptians<WH4714> shall know<WH3045> that I am Jehovah<WH3068>, when I have gotten me honor<WH3513> upon Pharaoh<WH6547>, upon his chariots<WH7393>, and upon his horsemen<WH6571>.

And the angel<WH4397> of God<WH430>, who went<WH1980> before<WH6440> the camp<WH4264> of Israel<WH3478>, removed<WH5265> and went<WH3212> behind<WH310> them<WH5982>; and the pillar of cloud<WH6051> removed<WH5265> from before them<WH6440>, and stood<WH5975> behind them<WH310>:

and it came<WH935> between the camp<WH4264> of Egypt<WH4714> and the camp<WH4264> of Israel<WH3478>; and there was the cloud<WH6051> and the darkness<WH2822>, yet gave it light<WH215> by night<WH3915>: and the one came not near<WH7126> the other<WH2088> all the night<WH3915>.

And Moses<WH4872> stretched out<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> over the sea<WH3220>; and Jehovah<WH3068> caused the sea<WH3220> to go<WH3212> back by a strong<WH5794> east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> all the night<WH3915>, and made<WH7760> the sea<WH3220> dry<WH2724> land<WH4325>, and the waters were divided<WH1234>.

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH935> into the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220> upon the dry<WH3004> ground<WH4325>: and the waters were a wall<WH2346> unto them on their right hand<WH3225>, and on their left<WH8040>.

And the Egyptians<WH4714> pursued<WH7291>, and went in<WH935> after<WH310> them into the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220>, all Pharaoh<WH6547>'s horses<WH5483>, his chariots<WH7393>, and his horsemen<WH6571>.

And it came to pass in the morning<WH1242> watch<WH821>, that Jehovah<WH3068> looked<WH8259> forth upon the host<WH4264> of the Egyptians<WH4714> through the pillar<WH5982> of fire<WH784> and of cloud<WH6051>, and discomfited<WH2000> the host<WH4264> of the Egyptians<WH4714>.

And he took off<WH5493> their chariot<WH4818> wheels<WH212>, and they drove<WH5090> them heavily<WH3517>; so that the Egyptians<WH4714> said<WH559>, Let us flee<WH5127> from the face<WH6440> of Israel<WH3478>; for Jehovah<WH3068> fighteth<WH3898> for them against the Egyptians<WH4714>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Stretch out<WH5186> thy hand<WH3027> over the sea<WH3220>, that the waters<WH4325> may come again<WH7725> upon the Egyptians<WH4714>, upon their chariots<WH7393>, and upon their horsemen<WH6571>.

And Moses<WH4872> stretched forth<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> over the sea<WH3220>, and the sea<WH3220> returned<WH7725> to its strength<WH386> when the morning<WH1242> appeared<WH6437>; and the Egyptians<WH4714> fled<WH5127> against<WH7125> it<WH3068>; and Jehovah overthrew<WH5287> the Egyptians<WH4714> in the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220>.

And the waters<WH4325> returned<WH7725>, and covered<WH3680> the chariots<WH7393>, and the horsemen<WH6571>, even all the host<WH2428> of Pharaoh<WH6547> that went<WH935> in after<WH310> them into the sea<WH3220>; there remained<WH7604> not so much as<WH5704> one of them<WH259>.

But the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> walked<WH1980> upon dry<WH3004> land in the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220>; and the waters<WH4325> were a wall<WH2346> unto them on their right hand<WH3225>, and on their left<WH8040>.

Thus Jehovah<WH3068> saved<WH3467> Israel<WH3478> that day<WH3117> out of the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>; and Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> the Egyptians<WH4714> dead<WH4191> upon the<WH3220> sea-shore<WH8193>.

And Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> the great<WH1419> work<WH3027> which Jehovah<WH3068> did<WH6213> upon the Egyptians<WH4714>, and the people<WH5971> feared<WH3372> Jehovah<WH3068>: and they believed<WH539> in Jehovah<WH3068>, and in his servant<WH5650> Moses<WH4872>.
